The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 4 units long, 2 units wide, and 1 unit tall. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of about 0.5 units. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, -0.1875] 2. Draw the 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0.195 units towards the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction of the normal, resulting in the creation of a new solid body. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End The second part is a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic pole or rod. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] * Translation Vector: [0.06, 0.1312, 0.0] 2. Draw the 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. For loop_1, draw the following curve: * circle_1: Center [0.0375, 0.0375], Radius 0.0375 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.075. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0 units towards the normal and 0.54 units in the opposite direction of the normal, resulting in a cut feature operation. Part 3: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered End The third part is similar to the second part, a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic pole or rod. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 180.0] * Translation Vector: [0.06, 0.6937, 0.0] 2. Draw the 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. 3. For loop_1, draw the following curve: * circle_1: Center [0.0375, 0.0375], Radius 0.0375 4. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.075. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch by a depth of 0 units towards the normal and 0.54 units in the opposite direction of the normal, resulting in a cut feature operation.</description>
